In the pictures, it's easy to see how much nicer the bedroom would look with updated bedding, etc. I will say that the pet policy is two-fold. On the one hand, they do a bang-up job of "welcoming" (ahem) pet guests. On the other hand, their pet policy doesn't allow the dog to be left alone in the room. I hope anyone staying at this hotel with a dog is only in town to walk their dogs or sit in their hotel rooms and watch television. Because with no ability to leave the dog at "home" alone, you can't: eat in the hotel restaurant, go shopping, take in a film, go to a museum, use the hotel's gym, etc., etc. If you're only at the hotel for a place to sleep for the night, then you might really appreciate the doggie amenities we found. They include: breed-appropriate-sized dog dishes on a mat; bottled water for the dog; two hand towels and a bedspread with your dog's name embroidered on them; some doggie treats; and a dog magazine. Had the hotel had a more reasonable pet policy, I would be glowingly recommending this hotel for pet owners. Alas, I can't...knowing what I know. The place needs to be refurbished with more modern amenities. That said, our King Suite was comfortably sized, and everything worked properly. It did feel a tad dingy, though. There are some newer (or more recently renovated) hotels in Toronto I would likely recommend before the Four Seasons...which is a shame, because it has the potential to maintain itself as a premier Yorkville hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best in Toronto's big hotels”
Reviews.Author: Payam81
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Four Seasons in a while but I was again treated to their excellent service nonetheless. Rooms are in the process of updating with new furniture. I was upgraded to a King room (originally booked queen) upon check in. My requested extra towels and amenities were at my room whit in 5 minutes of the request, something that sometimes takes several calls at, oh say, the Marriott on Bloor St. just down the road. Overall the personal service reminded me again of why I stay at Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: appletini82
Reviews.Content: This is the first Four Seasons that I have stayed at,but if every Four Seasons all over the world is like the Toronto one,I wouldn't stay at another Four Seasons. The furniture is not only outdated,the shower curtain in our bathroom has black stains.This is Four Seasons!Surely they could have done better!We booked a Standard room and it was cramped compared to other 5 star hotel rooms that we have stayed in. This hotel just isn't worth my $500/night.

Reviews.Title: “More like "One Season" vs "Four Seasons".”
Reviews.Author: mississippi64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are huge fans for the Four Season's and could not wait to stay at their flagship Canadian property in Toronto (their corporate headquarters). The staff was professional, curtious and knowledgable. However the hotel is extremely out of date. The bathrooms are in desperate need of an upgrade. The furniture was old and the rooms were worn-out. The concierge was the high point. They made several restaurant recommendations that were terrific. I read the reviews on this website before I made our reservations. Frankly, I did not trust them. I thought there is no way that the Four Season's flagship property is that out of date. Well...I will never make that mistake again. Location and staff are great. Perfect Four Season's quality. Unfortunately, the hotel is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite service in a slightly ageing hotel”
Reviews.Author: FansofEurope
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed from a Thursday night to a Sunday and really enjoyed the hotel. It is a 35 year old property and that means smaller bathrooms than newer hotels, but the room was lovely. The service from check in to departure was absolutely exceptional. Room service was fast ,courteous with very tasty food. The pool area is small and older but the service was again excellent. Restaurants were friendly and efficient. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Three and a half seasons”
Reviews.Author: AGR1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel was eveything that I could have asked for in a hotel, but I have to say, with the Four Seasons name attached, I was expecting slightly more. The customer service was wonderful, the fitness center was one of the best, there was classical music playing when we entered our rooms....I just though they were in dire need of some refreshing. The furniture, bedding and bathrooms were a bit tired and not what I would necessarily expect from the Four Seasons brand. That said, I have no complaints about my 3 day stay and I was informed by a Toronto local that they will be opening another Four Seasons at a different location in the city in the near future. Will definitely be checking it out the next time I'm in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “No way”
Reviews.Author: Jay175
Reviews.Content: It's a bit of a joke to say this one of the best hotels in Canada. There is no way this is a 5 star hotel. Yes the service is very good, but when you don't need anything it lets you see how old this place is. The rooms are outdated and the bath for example was one of the worst I seen in years. The is no sound proofing, and from the 19th floor you could hear every car, bus and motorbike that went past as if it was in the room. As tourists we didn't feel at all at ease, this is a business hotel that is used by people paid for by businesses. We had breakfast here one day, and talk about over the top... $20 plus tax, plus tip for a cup of coffee and a croissant... no buffet...!! Come on... I'm not surprised there were only 4 people in the place at 8.00am. The location of the hotel however is very good, as once again is the service. We will not be staying here again, even at half price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: Fearful
Reviews.Content: We were guests of the hotel for 3 nights (June 13-16 ) while attending a wedding which also took place there. We had a special rate of approximately $235.00. We are repeat visitors and have been to the hotel 3 times previously. Perhaps that is the explanation for the upgrade to a deluxe room with king size bed. I agree with many that the service is very good. I had neglected to make a brunch reservation on Father's day to celebrate that as well as my daughter's birthday. No problem: a call a few days before to the hotel resulted in us having a table at Avenues for brunch despite the restaurant being full. Avenues is a gorgeous contemporary room- furnished beautifully, great art, and lovely and accomodating service (can't decide between the crab cake and the French toast? we'll give you both), but the food was disappointing. We were even escorted to the elevator several times. Many of our wedding weekend clothes were creased as a result of packing. Again, no problem .They were whisked off to be pressed - beautifully - and returned promptly at the time requested. But note a huge price of over $100.00 for 4 garments. I also agree with many that the rooms are very ho hum. They are somewhat dated and are uninspiring. Our bathroom was very small and I don't believe that any 5 star hotel truly earns the honour if they offer a vinyl shower curtain. Moreover, we had to call for toiletries that were not restocked as well. Much apologizing about that omission. Turn down service every night, but sadly no chocolate. The hotel is truly a gracious experience: a warm cocoon. But if you want a fabulous room, pay accordingly or stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moovstr
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place! The location and service are incredible! Amenities, comfort and view were amazing. My vacation started in Toronto then we went to Boston, NY and back to Toronto. There was a week from the beginning of my trip to the end and we stayed at the Four Seasons in Toronto both times. When I returned at the end of my trip, the head door man remembered my name and welcomed me back - he knew I was gone! Amazing service!

Reviews.Title: “The secret is the service...”
Reviews.Author: Halinmich
Reviews.Content: So, first of all: this place isn't cheap. It's about the priciest indulgence one can give themselves for a Toronto stay. And the rooms alone are not worth it--though spotless, they're not opulent, and pretty out-of-date. Given all this, the service is impeccable--best I've ever had--and thus I've stayed here three times. Yorkville people-watching is fun, and I loved hanging out in the Lobby Bar or the Avenue Bar and checking out the comings-and-goings of the rich and famous. Also fun to walk down the street and have dinner/drinks at Sassafraz (have the concierge make you a reservation though). Staying at this hotel is what traveling first class on a large luxury ocean liner must have been like 70 or 80 years ago, when the table linens were spotless and pressed, and any and all requests were executed promptly and flawlessly. Four Seasons is addressing the need of a makeover by building a new hotel which will be open in a year or two, so until then I'll make do with this one. Once you get used to Four Seasons service, you'll never want to stay anywhere else. Book your room on the hotel website as an 'Escape to Toronto' package and you'll even save a little off the rack rate!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to stay at Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Oli-on-trip
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Four Seasons Toronto. The location at Yorkville is perfect next to many good restaurants, bars and shops. The ROM and the next subway station are also only arround a minute away by walking. The food at the restaurant was awesome including the breakfast. The bar was a good place for people watching and to enjoy great drinks. The staff was very attentive and friendly. Valet service and housekeeping remembered who we are and were really helpful. Our room was spacious and cozy. The bathroom was not the biggest but lovely. We had a fantastic view over the city thru CN tower. The bed was comfortable and the room calm so we had slept well.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star All the Way”
Reviews.Author: BuddyMalloy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, a Saturday and a Sunday, recently with my wife. It was a getaway before the birth of our first baby. And boy, did we make the right choice. From the moment we got out of our car to the moment they packed our trunk when we left, we were treated like royalty. Let's start at the beginning. The room was great. The furniture may be an older style, but everything was in immaculate condition and perfect working order. Very, very comfortable. The staff set up a DVD player for us in our room, no problem. The bed was heavenly, and robes were provided without us having to ask. The room, the bathroomâ€¦even the balcony, everything was extremely clean. Carpet was nice and thick and the hotel seems to have gone through a renovation recently. On our 2nd day, one of the staff noticed we had put some beverages (too large to fit in the minibar) on the balcony to stay cool, and they brought in a small fridge, and moved our beverages into it. Wow, that's service! Truffles Restaurant. Dinner on our first night. I believe this is the only 5 star restaurant in Toronto and it lives up to that rating. Both the service and the food were beyond excellent. When I asked for something not on the menu, it was no problem. When my wife requested a special dessert because of a medical condition, no problem. The staff even mentioned that they'd spoken to the chef about it and the chef had ensured the main course ingredients were tailored slightly to fit her special diet. Room Service. Dinner our 2nd night. and breakfast both mornings. Wow, just as good as the restaurant. Everything was delivered as ordered and everything was fresh and hot. The mutigrain bread may have been the best I've ever had. Ooohhh...the bread. Avenue Restaurant. Had lunch there one day. It was packed but service was still very good. Food was excellent. Workout facility. I think their pool is a tad on the small size, but it is unique. It's open year around and is 20% on the inside, 80% on the outside (you swim under a partition...and the pool is heated). Good size hot tub, and very nice work out room. Juices, water, coffee, tea and fresh fruit are provided free of charge. Front Desk Staff and Valet. Excellent. Valet were always courteous to open the door for us, and our car was brought up without delay (the daily parking charge includes in/out privileges). This is a great hotel in a great location. Right in the heart of Yorkville, with access to many restaurants, shops and cinemas. Sure, you're going to have to splurge but in our case it was worth every penny. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Hotelero1
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is over 30 years old and can't compare to many of the newer Four Seasons properties, it has aged well. The public areas are immaculately maintained and the rooms are very comfortable. We were upgraded to a suite which is the size of a small apartment - two bathrooms, a parlour and a king bed. After five days we felt right at home and really did not want to leave. While the decor and furnishings are a little fussy and outdated, the emphasis is on comfort and in that it succeeds. As expected the service was professional and courteous, although the Concierge and Reception staff were merely perfunctory. The location is fantastic - within walking distance to the Yorkville shops and several museums, and ten minutes by taxi or subway to downtown. An excellent choice for a business or pleasure trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Super Guest Services!”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPolo001
Reviews.Content: Everytime I stay at this property, I am impressed with the concierge. They got me last minute reservations at the best restaurants which were already sold out. The location is just great in the middle of Yorkville. Its the place to be in this town.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Charrynn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work. It's OK. Nothing special. Certainly not what one would expect of a Four Seasons. The gym\pool was impressive, although rather small. My colleague who is probably 6'4" was given a room with a twin bed. Unbelievable...

Reviews.Title: “Bad Architecture and Decor -- With Excellent Service.”
Reviews.Author: nycinvestmentbanker
Reviews.Content: First, the good news.... We love love love the Four Seasons and we have a great affinity for this hotel due to some personal connections. The service is beyond compare. Every question to management was answered with a 'certainly' and a smile. The hotel also has a certain 'celebrity factor' for those celebs shooting film about town. The location is beyond compare with great shopping, parks, and restaurants nearby. However, if you stay, you should be aware that the hotel is rather old and has become dingy. Rather than upgrade this property, Four Seasons is building a new hotel about a block away (ground unbroken). So, you will have to enjoy such things as small tubs, dingy carpet, low ceilings, odd decor and uneven temperatures in suites. The gym and pool remain unupdated in over a decade. Think slab concrete with limited equipment and no views. Also, i would not feel like a spa treatment here as the facility is simply not luxurious. The menu for room service is not bad but it is not spectacular either. We would like to have seen more Canadian items and quicker, faster food delivery. Instead, most meals were luke-warm and lacked variation. However, service was nice. Our checkin was probably the best ever and every problem we had was addressed. For example, a maintenance worker walked in on us changing even though we had a 'do not disturb' sign and had asked him not to. Unfortunately, an internet upgrade in the building was unannounced and much time was spent on fixing it so I could write this review. Management was apologetic and made things right but it should never had 'come to this'. Overall, this is the grand dame hotel of Toronto and the birthplace of the Four Seasons concept (thanks, Izzy Sharpe). However, this Four Seasons is not typical of the overall experience except for the politeness of the staff. We hope to see some major renovations or the new building up very soon. We would also love to see this Four Seasons establish itself as the headquarters for the chain and introduce wonderful new ideas here instead of lagging the entire chain. Why not try out a new concept or menu idea here? Many intelligent clients would be very willing to give you their honest response.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service, great gym, but strangely out of date decor”
Reviews.Author: ValueSeekerRW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple nights for business. I came in very late (around midnight) and was greeted warmly and even upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The suite was certainly large, but the decor was dated and worn, and really didn't exude the luxury one would expect. The gym is fantastic. The machinese are well maintained--I wish I had more time to make full use of the facilities which included a pool, hot tub and fruit juices/coffee in the morning. The location is great---I didn't realize how close we were to the Royal Ontario Museum which is dynamite. Studio Cafe on the premises is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Three Seasons Hotel Toronto”
Reviews.Author: 5starsforme
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews for this hotel, it almost feels like we stayed at a different hotel! What cookies, robes and cute little sponges for the kids? We didn't get anything like that. We have stayed at many Four Seasons and have never been so unimpressed. The rooms were dingy and small and although we were assured by Amex that we were eligible for an upgrade if available, the hotel staff told us that we were not. In general, the staff was friendly and the room service orders were brought quickly. But there was nothing special about the hotel in general. It feels like time for a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the World - READ if you have kids”
Reviews.Author: ontmom
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel - I won't be able to say enough! We arrived for a 2 night stay for special occasion I set up for my husband, with our young children. The children were greeted with stuffed animals and up in our room, found fresh, warm happy face cookies, tiny robes and slippers and the hotel arranged wine for our special occasion ensuring the ice for the wine was fresh (even though they had no idea when we were arriving!!!). But the true measure of this wonderful place was the staff. I had set up babysitting for the children so we could eat at their 5 star restaurant on the second night of our stay. Unfortunately, our son became ill with an ear infection during the first night and the hotel bent over backwards to help us - sending a doctor on call to our room (this in Canada where NO doctor makes house calls) within one hour (he was on the phone with us in under 5 minutes). They ran to the store for medicines. They allowed us a late check-out so our son could sleep before we left early and did not charge us for the last minute cancellation of our babysitter or the triple confirmed second night of our stay. They treated the children as if they were the most important guests at the hotel and went out of their way to acknowledge them at every opportunity. They had a super reasonably priced kids menu - room service hamburgers which were HUGE were $7 with fries, works and served just as you would expect to be served as an adult- $5 hotdogs, $4 salad/veggie trays - all for kids - french toast etc. in the morning with nothing over $5. Absolutely outstanding! We had a beautiful two room suite that was VERY reasonably priced and perfectly appointed - with two bathrooms! I could not thank the staff more and wanted to write this review as soon as we got home so that every parent booking a trip to Toronto could benefit from this place - WORTH EVERY CENT!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Far From The Maddening Crowd”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Observer
Reviews.Content: For the best "Rest & Relaxation", you must consider staying at the Four Seasons on Toronto's Yorkville area. Here, I found the best of two worlds " Far From The Maddening Crowd" - peace and quietness. Unless you are a writer, you can't appreciate this fully. This property was impeccable maintained and the staff prompt, friendly, and knowledgeable (some of my pet-peeves). Dining places near the hotel (in my opinion) were upscaled and great. Just about "everything" you would want to get (while on vacation) was readily available in the many shops in this Yorkville area and if you want "bargains", just walk across "Bloor Street" and there you are! The more you walk SOUTH of Bloor Street, the more "conjested" it became as you got into the downtown area of Toronto. During the time I was there, the "Caribana Festival" was climaxing and the streets (south of Bloor Street) were filled, both day and night, with party goers and roving groups of "young folks". But all of that seemed to "disappear" once you cross "northward" of Bloor Street. Will I return to the Four Seasons again? "YOU BETCHA!"

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons is amazing”
Reviews.Author: precious68
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Four Seasons Toronto. It was a "girls" weekend - so there was no better location in Toronto stay - in the middle of Yorkville, in the midst of the best shopping, dining, and neighborhood in the city!! Service at the hotel was beyond compare! The staff are amazing, and go out of their way to ensure you are happy!! Rooms were average - nice bedding, but the real difference between the Four Seasons and other hotels is definitely the service. Food is great, and Avenue Bar is quite a place to people watch, especially later in the evening. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “COMPLETELY Lives up to its reputation! GREAT Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCGeechieGal
Reviews.Content: Believe me...anyone who gives the Four Seasons Toronto less than an EXCELLENT rating probably doesn't get out much and really doesn't know hotels very well. As a constant business traveller who spends more time in hotels internationally than I do at home, I can say that the FS is a FABULOUS hotel with all of the amenities you could ever want in lodging. Short and sweet: GREAT staff, EXCELLENT food (and mojitos), COMFORTABLE, well appointed rooms with a micro-sound system that is IPod/mp3 compatible. FS takes customer service to a COMPLETELY different level. Never any hassles, bill surprises or rudeness. I usually stay on the 28-29th floor and have a nice view of Lake Ontario. The location is superb with an arts theatre a couple of minutes walk away and it's just around the corner from high end shopping on Bloor st in Yorkville. If you're in the area, you must check out Holt Renfew--the window dressings during the holidays are fantastic! Toronto is a GREAT city and the FS epitomizes it!

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason why Four Seasons is the best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Windstory
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly impressed with the Four Seasons Toronto and as avid Four Seasons travellers understand why this company is cream of the crop. My wife and I brought our three children for an annual trip to Toronto to visit family. The room set-up was a two bedroom suite with an incredibly comfortable king size bed in one room, a large parlour room and a second bedroom with twin beds perfect for my children! After making my resrevation online and calling a few days later to check all was in order, the reservation's person asked for the ages and names of my children. I did not think anything of it at the time, but upon arrival to our room the hotel had prepared lovely room service plates for each of them, and my youngest had his name spelled out with sponges on the side of the bathtub! Right from the moment we arrived we felt like royalty. The Front Desk agent spoke to all my kids using their names, and presented them with lovely little stuffed toys. They were so thrilled, especially that the agent knew their names... they thought that was great! Every staff person from the Housekeepers, staff in the elevator, bell staff, door staff were smiling, friendly and genuinely seemed happy to be there and ready/willing to serve. Pool area is great for families in the summer. They have a large number of loungers and also provide a full menu from the pool bar so your children can go crazy in the pool and you can relax with a good book out by the pool and pass the day away. In terms of location no hotel in the city can compete. Trendy Yorkville is where you want to be when travelling Toronto and the Four Seasons is smack in the middle of all the shopping and nightlife. Overall a 10 out of 10! Will be back next year for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Not so Four Seasons...”
Reviews.Author: sheshelala
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons is diminishing there overall reputation with this hotel. I understand it is old, and one of the first Four Seasons ever constructed - which is why I don't understand the lacking service. Even when room rates go down, service should never be compromised. The staff arn't helpful at all. Its almost like pulling a tooth to get something out of someone. The doorman never opened the door, but were simply talking to he other doorman at the stand.The front desk needs a lesson or two in customer service, and a possible smile with a "how are you today?" I work in the hospitality industry - so many I judge to harshly. But given that this is the Four Seasons, they should realy focus on providing extraordinary service to all. If its there service that sets them apart, they need to rethink their approach. At other Four Seasons', you can spot the GM walking through the hotel, asking guests about their experience. I never once even saw a manager and I was there for a full-week. Truffles is great. Avenue and the Studio Cafe are great as well. But this hotel needs some serious attitude overhauls with there staff. Maybe hiring people that look good in a suit is the wrong approach. Find people that exibit that sense of providing exceptional customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but rooms not as great as expected”
Reviews.Author: ProNavigator
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in March. I expected a more luxurious hotel based on the Four Seasons reputation and website. While the common areas are indeed lovely, and food and beverage quality good, the room decor fell flat. It didn't feel like a luxery property and I had little desire to spend time in the room relaxing/reading/taking a bath (small tub). The bed itslef was very comfortable and the linens and towels up to par to the Four Seasons but the bathrooms are small with no fan, and overall the lighting was dim. Another beef is that the Lobby bar shuts down early with the alternative being the noisy Avenue bar, not a great place to sit and chat. This is a great location for shopping on Bloor St and is close to the ROM and University. I certainly felt safe running alone in the morning. There is a great bakery just up the road for croissants or muffins. We also had a fantastic dinner at a nearby restaurant called Joso's - I highly recommend it if you like fresh fish.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SumNetGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons to treat myself. At $350, I expected more than a tiny room with average furniture and fixtures. The room looked and felt no nicer than most three-star properties. The service is lovely, and the location fabulous -- but a poor value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Can recommend”
Reviews.Author: FSWKent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in December 2006 and can definitely recommend it. Couldnâ€™t afford it normally but I got a good corporate rate through work. As some previous reviews have stated, this hotel does have rather old fashioned rooms. However, the standard of cleanliness and the helpfulness of the staff is very good. They treat their guests exceptionally well with no hint of any snooty attitude you get at some luxury hotels. I didnâ€™t eat in any of their restaurants so canâ€™t comment on the food. Concierge very helpful with booking tickets for Greyhound bus to Niagara when I am sure they are more used to booking limos. Very frustrating as she had to hold on phone for ages with one of those dreaded â€˜automatedâ€™ phone systems but she couldnâ€™t have been more amenable. If you donâ€™t want to pay hotel prices for breakfast, can also highly recommend the Over Easy Diner, 208 Bloor St. W. up the road from the hotel, we had breakfast here every morning and it was always good. If I did go to Toronto again and could get a good rate I would definitely stay here. S Walters, Kent

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints with the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in room 2115 from November 3, 2006 to November 5, 2006. The room was paid for by my wifeâ€™s employer so I do not know how much it cost. Overall we were very pleased with the service, accommodations, and location. The hotel is located in the Yorkville section of Toronto and in a nice area for shopping and restaurants. The room was of average size, but very clean and did not show any age. The bed was very comfortable and had an ample number of pillows. The television had about 60 channel selections and looked like it was brand new (other reviews mentioned old televisions). The bathroom was spacious with a large tub and had all the amenities we would need. I have never stayed in a hotel that had such strong water pressure in the bathroom, which was a plus. The turndown service was also appreciated. I very much enjoyed the health spa. It had complimentary robes, free water bottles, free fruits, and was open until 10:00 pm every night. The pool water was very warm and you could swim outdoors or indoors by opening a partition. The whirlpool was great with water that was not too hot and had the strongest jets I have ever experienced in a hot tub. They also had a nice exercise room which I did not use. The room also had a balcony with chairs. Although it was cold, this would have been a really nice place to relax in warmer weather with a nice view of downtown Toronto and the CN Tower. I was very impressed with the friendliness of the hotel staff. They were very polite saying hello whenever they saw me. When I asked George and another male front desk staff member for information about any nearby Chinese food restaurants, they went out of their way to help by giving me very detailed instructions about getting there, calling the restaurant for a reservation, and recommending a certain dish. My wife and I usually go on a lot of vacations every year and we can afford to do sp by not staying in expensive hotels and cutting travel costs as much as possible. We had previously visited Toronto about four years ago and stayed at the Toronto Marriott Eaton Centre and were very impressed with their accommodations. There was not a whole lot of difference between the Marriott Eaton Centre and the Four Seasons, except for the room rates and room size, which are much cheaper and larger at the Marriott respectively. I very much enjoyed my stay at the Four Seasons and really did not have any complaints, but I feel your money could go a lot further at a less prestigious hotel with similar amenities. Marc T. Hardekopf

Reviews.Title: “Tacky decor and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: YVR_guestservices
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the vaunted Four Seasons in Toronto. Its reputation is legendary and it is the flagship of the Four Seasons chain. That said, what's promised and what's delivered are very different. Much is made of the 4S's Yorkville location. Yorkville is not as chic and the sidewalk cafes not as elegant as one would think. The cafes are loud and overpriced. There are a number of trashy nightclubs in the neighbourhood and after hours their customers are up and down the street roaring motorcycle engines and blasting music from SUVs. Hardly conducive to a good night's sleep. On this basis alone I would stay away from the 4 Seasons! The decor is dated, fussy and worn. The trend in hotels these days seems to be towards simplicity and comfort; the 4 Seasons seems to be on a quest to have the largest number of fabrics, finishes and trims in each room possible. Everywhere I looked I saw worn upholstery and chipped paint and trim. The staff seem to think they are GUESTS at a five-star rather than EMPLOYEES. I happen to like to keep a large glass of ice water beside the bed at nightwhile I sleep. I called down to the concierge to ask for a larger glass and the response was, "You can use the glasses on the vanity." Thanks a heap - I know I can use those glasses, but I didn't WANT TO. Because of problems with my company credit card I had occasion to need help from the front desk a number of times, and each time, the same story: people who were more obviously wealthy and had the corresponding enlarged sense of entitlement were allowed to butt into line or simply interrupt a conversation. I was speaking with a front desk agent and a 5th avenue matron type stood right beside me, clacking her nails on the counter. After I had been there several minutes she simply leaned in front of me and asked the girl to call her a taxi! Without a bat of an eye she asked the lady where she was going and so on, at which point the lady next asked for a good hair stylist, then for a copy of the wine list to be sent to her room...and the agent completely forgot about the guest she was already with! Granted the lady's manners were atrocious but the agent should have had better customer service skills than to allow one guest to take over from another. I was walking by again about 30 minutes and overheard this agent COMPLAINING ABOUT A GUEST to another agent, within earshot of anyone approaching the desk. Very classy. Overpriced and overrated the 4 Seasons is one place I wish I had never slept in. In my opinion they are coasting on their reputation and doing nothing to earn it. Avoid, avoid, avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Tired Suite”
Reviews.Author: trippmahan
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the Four Seasons brand and was very disappointed with how tired my suite at the Four Seasons Toronto was. Given that the chain is developing a new property in Toronto, I don't imagine much will be done to improve the existing property. While the location is good, the building is dated. The pool area and gym is in dire need of an update. Service was fantastic as it always is. The hallways seemed to be redone and were fine. Overall, I just couldn't recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Treated my daughter wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came to visit the FS Toronto for a long weekend. When we arrived we were upgraded to a Jr. Suite Deluxe with two bathrooms. we were a little confused because of all the complaints we have read about this hotel. Our room was recently redone, and actually upto our expecttions with Four Seasons. The hotel itself could use some modernization, but it still bleeds excellence. The staff made our infant daughter their princess. Every request we had, and even things we did not ask for we given to us. I commend the staff on a job well done. We try to stay in Four Seasons whenever we can, and while this may not compare to the FS in Maui, Chicago, Palm Beach, Miami, or London, it still is better than the rest in Toronto. We have stayed at its so called equivalant, the Park Hyatt, and the FS is still superior.

Reviews.Title: “Great service only takes you so far”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here about ten times, because the people I go to Toronto with always want to, and it's hard to argue with the Yorkville location (which I think is the best in town) or the unparalleled service, which is why I've given it a four. I certainly think it's nice to be greeted by name every day, and if that's what you are after, look no further. But I'd rather have a nice, new, updated bathroom, with an incredible shower and maybe some new bedspreads, and so next time I'm going to try something else. I really think they should take the exorbitant prices and use them to r.e.n.o.v.a.t.e. It doesn't have to turn into some uber-hip dark place to get nicer -- just new bathrooms, new fluffier towels, and some color scheme my great grandmother did not have in her living room. People in town are starting to call this place the Holiday Inn. It's the flagship Four Seasons property and doesn't even come close to their other outposts.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful birthday”
Reviews.Author: somebody_else
Reviews.Content: We were there for a 70th birthday celebration. Every person we dealt with treated us like royalty, beginning with the doorman, who whisked our luggage into a secure room as we headed inside. "We have a policy never to leave luggage unattended", he explained to me. How different from so many other hotels, where you often see piles of luggage in the lobby and outside, with minimal attention paid to them. We were upgraded to a suite, and the check-in agent walked us to the elevator. The room was immaculate and the turn-down service included another cleaning, not just towel-refreshing and bed-straightening. Wow! The bathroom amenities are by L'Occitane de Provence, and small wonderful. Dinner at Truffles was FABULOUS - our waiter was attentive, charming, knowledgeable and yet still gave us lots of privacy. The manager sent champagne to our table, in honour of the birthday. The food was delicious, from the bread at the table, through the complimentary amuse-bouche of duck, through lovely appetizers (including a caesar salad that wasn't on the menu, but they were happy to prepare), through the main courses (especially the chicken served with bacon-wrapped truffles), and let me tell you about the desserts! The Grande Marnier souffles were gorgeous, served with a grande marnier cream sauce. My berries with ice cream (also not on the menu but they were happy to oblige) were perfect and at the peak of freshness. The chef came out to the tables to ask if we had enjoyed our meal and if we had any questions. They also served us a complimentary chocolate birthday cake and complimentary chocolate truffles! This was the most amazing meal any of us had ever eat! en. We were so sorry to leave the hotel. But when we did, the valet brought our car up and had put 2 bottles of water in the cup-holders for us. We are definitely returning!
